controller

Class WorkHive

  • java.lang.Object
    • controller.WorkHive

  • public class WorkHive
extends java.lang.Object
    A class that is handling the usage of threads. The creation of the administrative threads is performed in createSeparateThreads while the threads that handles the logic related to the Board are created in the method createUpdateNeighborThreads and method createSetNextGenThreads.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      WorkHive()
      No-parameter constructor.

      Sets the Board-object on which to perform concurrent methods on.

    • Constructor Detail

      • WorkHive

    • Method Detail

      • createUpdateNeighborThreads

        public static void createUpdateNeighborThreads(int numberOfThreads)
        Creates the threads that handle updating the board of neighbors. The number of threads created is multiplied by two, creating two times as many threads as there are available processors. The board is divided in size between the threads and each thread is provided with colPlace which corresponds to the base of the index and colWidth which corresponds to the offset of the index. After the threads are created, their start-methods are called through method orderAnts where the threads with an odd numbered index starts first and then their join-methods are called before the same process is performed with the even numbered index threads.
        Parameters:
        numberOfThreads - the number of available processors
        See Also:
        orderAnts()

      • createSetNextGenThreads

        public static void createSetNextGenThreads(int numberOfThreads)
        Creates the threads that handle setting the next generation for the board. The number of threads created is multiplied by two, creating two times as many threads as there are available processors. The board is divided in size between the threads and each thread is provided with colPlace which corresponds to the base of the index and colWidth which corresponds to the offset of the index. After the threads are created, their start-methods are called through method orderAnts where the threads with an odd numbered index starts first and then their join-methods are called before the same process is performed with the even numbered index threads.
        Parameters:
        numberOfThreads - the number of available processors
        See Also:
        orderAnts()

      • createSeparateThreads

        public static void createSeparateThreads(int numberOfThreads)
        Prepares the threads that handles updating the board of neighbors and setting the next generation. The process of creating the threads is performed by two runnable tasks, FirstThreadTask that creates the threads that updates the board of neighbors and the SecondThreadTask that creates the threads that sets the next generation. The first task is then started and then joined before the second task is created and then joined.
        Parameters:
        numberOfThreads - the number of available processors

      • orderAnts

        public static void orderAnts()
                      throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Starting every second thread, waiting for every second thread to join before starting the remaining threads and waiting for them to join before returning. Since the with of the Board have been split into a number of thinner column this means that first the odd numbered columns will be checked then the even numbered.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - if one of the threads are interrupted
        See Also:
        the ArrayList containing the threads

      • setBoard

        public static void setBoard(Board board)
        Sets the Board-object on which to perform concurrent methods on.
        Parameters:
        board - the board to set
